item.title: Grass Damage, 9th January
item.description:
Yet again the grass in Croydon Rd Recreation Ground has been damaged/destroyed by council/contractors vehicles been driven over it. In this particular instance they appeared to be doing a visual inspection of something so easily could have parked up and walked. The state of the grass in many areas is very bad and it’s unbelievable it’s being caused by the organisation supposed to be maintaining it! (The cordoned off area near the toilet block is a marshy swamp this was also caused by contractor vehicles.).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waldens Road, St Mary Cray, Greater London

item.title: Street light out, 9th January
item.description:
Street light out for nearly 2months, It is very dark, have elderly and young children, when trying to put them in the car, the road is very busy anyway, and can get dangerous when trying to do this safely .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 193, Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars outside Dulwich Village Infants School, 9th January
item.description:
Could you consider a no stopping sign and camera outside Dulwich Village Infants School that runs the entire length of the school's estate up to where the zebra crossing is? Alternatively could you have a parking attendant there 07.40am onwards until 09.00 and then again around 15.00 - 15.40? Irresponsible drivers are stopping, putting on hazard lights and then leaving their vehicles to dropping off and collect children and today is the third occasion that I have seen an accident narrowly avoided when a cyclist tried to get round a car and was almost hit by a driver. It feels like a serious accident is imminent.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Dulwich Village, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 abandoned bins, 9th January
item.description:
Have reported this multiple times including REF 8589139, REF 8566408 and REF 8553245 - all references have been changed to fixed and have said that it would be resolved in the weekly cleanse. It *still* has not been resolved. PLEASE do not close this without resolution. Big black bin is permanently in pathway and full up, and is a dangerous obstacle for pedestrians especially with the primary school next door. This bin has been on the pathway for months without moving outside number 104. 2 new bins have joined this bin, are overflowing, and the combination of all 3 are causing a real hazard and blockage on the pathway.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwood Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Braham Street LONDON E1 8EE, 9th January
item.description:
The memorial for TFL employees who were victims of Covid is surrounded by dumped litter, cans, bottles and plastic. Very sad that a memorial should be in such a mess. What if relatives wanted to visit? No cleaning donethere for months.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep Pothole in Middle of Road, 9th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charlton Road, Charlton

item.title: Random bin near Waitrose, 9th January
item.description:
This was reported before and the ticket was closed. The bin is still in place with a shopping basket of rubbish next to it. Who does this bin belong to and why is rubbish left next to it on a daily basis that does not appear to be removed. The bin needs to be removed and replaced back to either Waitrose or the Travelodge bin area. Please can this be actioned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light not working, 9th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Regency Way, Blendon, Greater London
